All Implemented Interfaces:
org.eclipse.swt.graphics.Drawable
Enclosing class:
Widgets
public static class Widgets.FileTextField
extends Widgets.VComposite

A custom widget that is used to provide a way for the user to specify a file; it combines a label, a Browse button, and a text field. The Browse button pops up a file browser; that lets the user browse for a file; the path of the selected file is then put into the text field. Or the user can type into the text field directly.

Author:
David Cok

Widgets.FileTextField

public Widgets.FileTextField(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite parent,
                             java.lang.String label,
                             java.lang.String initialValue,
                             java.lang.String toolTipText,
                             int length)
Constructs the composite widget as a member of the given parent and with the given parameters.

Parameters:
parent - The container this new widget is made part of
label - The label to be used for this widget (e.g. the purpose of the directory being identified)
initialValue - The initial value for the text field (a directory path)
toolTipText - The explantory text used as a tooltip
length - The size of the visible part of the field, in characters
